Draw line 4, going from [0.266, 0.1679] to [0.0, 0.109]. Finally, create line 5, connecting the end of line 4 to the beginning of line 1, at [0.0, 0.0]. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and the translation vector from the coordinate system. Extrude the sketch along the positive Z-axis by 0.0392 units. **<part\\_2>** Construct a cylindrical object with a flat top and bottom and a curved side. In the center of the top surface, there is a rectangular hole. Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector to [0.0392, 0.2661, 0.0818]. Draw the first face in the X-Y plane. Begin by creating arc 1, moving counter-clockwise from [0.0223, 0.0541] to [0.0271, 0.0]; the arc’s mid point lies at [0.0, 0.0248]. Draw line 1, starting at [0.0271, 0.0] and ending at [0.1907, 0.0]. Continue with arc 2, starting at [0.1907, 0.0], moving clockwise to [0.1955, 0.0541]; the mid point is at [0.2178, 0.0248]. Next, create arc 3, going counter-clockwise from [0.1955, 0.0541] to [0.0223, 0.0541]; the mid point is at [0.1089, 0.0619]. This completes loop 1. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.2178. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and the translation vector from the coordinate system. Subtractively extrude the sketch along the negative Z-axis by 0.0545 units. The final CAD model will be a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>
